tweets.text:
So what has @DefraGovUK, @Ofwat, @EnvAgency, @NaturalEngland, the water industry and cheating got to do with a Sex Pistols gig on the 14th Jan 1978 in San Francisco?

You're going to have to tune in tomorrow night to find out.

You know it makes sense.

https://t.co/JPSyolWS2R

We've completed the installation of 'property flood resilience' (PFR) products at the first house that opted in as part of the York Flood Alleviation Scheme. It's the first installation of 54 properties in the New Walk 'flood cell'.  Eligible properties can get PFR up to £7,500. https://t.co/t87VKd9dgQ

We are asking people in Devon to ask tradespeople where they are taking your green waste? Please follow the advice in the link to stop fly-tipping #CleanDevon https://t.co/kxX28GBzfm https://t.co/v0zPggUrwC
Working together with NGO partners and government partners including the @EnvAgencyNW we can make a difference, the will is there.... https://t.co/k9wUIahgzX

It's National Plant Health Week! 🌱

Plants are a precious natural resource that sustains life, but they also face threats from pests or diseases.  

Watch our video to find out why plants are so important and how you can help keep them healthy.  

#PlantHealthWeek #IYPH2020 https://t.co/KA8jWNsZ5P

.@EnvAgency river pollution report is much-needed ‘wake-up call’ for urgent environmental action, says Ribble Rivers Trust @RibbleTrust chief exec @JackSpees; read more on #TheCountryman website: https://t.co/rJkPLn1NyV
@RibbleLife @Feargal_Sharkey @JackPerksPhoto https://t.co/fDjT55IFBv

⚡In an effort to reduce city's #AirPollution, @TelAviv, together with ElectReon & Dan Bus Company launched a pilot project to install wireless electric roads, enabling travel for specially-equipped electric buses, capable of being charged from under-road electric infrastructure. https://t.co/b24WTEtP6a

EA Chair @EmmaHowardBoyd has written a letter in today’s @thetimes about how @EnvAgency is protecting our waters and will work with all those who want to be part of the solution. Read more here 👇

I have three messages today.
“Message one: a healthy environment means healthy humans, and an unhealthy environment means unhealthy humans.

Message two: investing in a healthy environment is about the smartest thing we can do." It makes medical, economic sense, and social sense. https://t.co/Uh3ZIwRz1o

tweets.text: “>Exposure to pollution and access to nature are not equally distributed across society - people living in deprived areas often have poorer quality environments with less accessible green space. They also have worse health. There is a link.” https://t.co/bHEVmRFJAc

“>Air pollution is the single biggest environmental threat to health in the UK, shortening tens of thousands of lives each year.

>Environmental factors – pollution, flooding, climate change – are contributing to the increase in mental health conditions we are seeing.” https://t.co/Qx4Ho79hLN

tweets.text: It’s dune grass planting time!! Late September through to early April is the perfect time to plant Marram and Lyme grasses. In 2019 over 1,500,000 hours worth of sewage was dumped into our rivers.

2020 every single river in England is polluted, NONE meet ‘Good’ overall environmental status.
 
Meanwhile @EnvAgency’s CEO makes a speech about the NHS.

Fiddling while Rome burns.

https://t.co/ylCeEQVypm

The largest river island restoration scheme in the UK (8 hectares)

Have your say on Tadcaster flood scheme plans.
We will be consulting residents & business owners from 30 Sept to 14 Oct.
Due to govt. guidance this will be done online through a new website (link to be posted early next week) & via Tadcaster Today newsletter (arriving soon). https://t.co/YVg7Xu44ca

We're excited to share latest pic of new river channel @StaffsUni. This project will create a more dynamic and diverse river habitat  for a wider range of wild species, such as brown trout, otters & kingfishers. @EnvAgencyMids @StaffsUnion @WildTroutTrust @Sotlive @BBCRadioStoke https://t.co/9m2H2PsiHP

@EnvAgencyMids fisheries enforcement officers are out on the River Trent at Cavendish Bridge. Lots of anglers out enjoying the sunshine. Remember to have a valid rod licence to #gofishing https://t.co/iaQzgcGqB9

The @EnvAgency has temporarily suspended its definition of waste service (DoW) until at least 1 January 2021 in order to bolster its national permitting service, which has been hit by delays.
https://t.co/lccFMJZdH2

@floodmary We look forward to working with @NottsCC in this new initiative which we welcome strongly. We hope to have the widest engagement with our excellent partners like @EnvAgencyMids @Trent_R_Trust @TVIDBOLD @viaeastmidlands @NSDCouncil This is potentially good progress.

#TeamEA is continuing gravel removal works along the River Kent in #Kendal this week as part of the annual gravel removal programme. Read more about the works online via the @thefloodhub 👉👉https://t.co/P2xiGrCxjT https://t.co/Xp6FMXF24T
